entries.title: Black Lives Matter co-founder’s cousin killed in police incident
entries.description: English teacher Keenan Anderson went into cardiac arrest after being Tasered by US police during a visit to Los Angeles.

entries.title: US regulator charges two crypto firms with unregistered offerings
entries.description: The SEC charged Genesis, Gemini with illegally selling securities to hundreds of thousands of investors.

entries.title: US extends temporary deportation protection to Somali citizens
entries.description: Washington says armed conflict and humanitarian crisis in Somalia make it impossible for citizens to return safely.

entries.title: Proud Boys did not ‘stand back, stand by’ on Jan 6: US prosecutor
entries.description: Prosecutor accuses far-right group members of 'mobilising' to storm Capitol as seditious conspiracy trial begins.

entries.title: Democratic lawmakers urge Biden to revoke Bolsonaro’s US visa
entries.description: The former Brazilian president has taken up residence in Florida, leading to an outcry from House Democrats.

entries.title: Mexico deploys National Guard to city subway amid sabotage fears
entries.description: Rights groups worry about 'lack of transparency' as the quasi-military force deploys to address 'not normal' incidents.

entries.title: NASA: 2022 tied for the fifth hottest year on record
entries.description: Scientists say temperatures will continue to rise as governments fail to rein in fossil fuel consumption.

entries.title: Russia soldier jailed for refusing to join Ukraine war
entries.description: Russian court sentenced Marsel Kandarov to five years in jail for refusing to take part in 'special military operation'.

entries.title: ‘I didn’t steal funds’ says former crypto titan Bankman-Fried
entries.description: In a highly unusual post-arrest blogpost a month after his arrest, he said he 'didn't stash billions away'.

entries.title: UAE pledges $3bn loan to help cash-strapped ally Pakistan
entries.description: Existing loan of $2bn will be topped with an additional loan of $1bn, a statement by Pakistani premier's office says.

entries.title: Sweden discovers largest rare earth deposit in Europe
entries.description: EU wants other sources than China for these crucial minerals, but it will be 10-15 years before Sweden's are available.

entries.title: US consumer prices moderate in December
entries.description: The sixth straight year-over-year slowdown is raising hopes that the worst inflation bout is steadily waning.

entries.title: India cough syrup linked to Uzbekistan deaths ‘substandard’: WHO
entries.description: The World Health Organization said the Indian manufacturer's products had 'unacceptable amounts' of toxic substances.

entries.title: Who is Russia’s new Ukraine war commander Valery Gerasimov?
entries.description: The seniority of the new general in charge reflects the war's expansion and need to improve organisation and command.

entries.title: White House confirms more classified files found at Biden’s home
entries.description: Joe Biden says his administration is 'cooperating fully' with Justice Department review of handling of classified files.

entries.title: Czech presidential election: What you need to know
entries.description: Eight candidates hope to replace Milos Zeman, who has been criticised for overstepping his role.

entries.title: ‘A new industrial age’: Report highlights renewable-energy boom
entries.description: Jobs in clean-energy manufacturing will more than double from six million to nearly 14 million by 2030, report says.

entries.title: Sri Lanka ex-leader ordered to compensate Easter bombing victims
entries.description: Supreme Court finds ex-president Sirisena and four other officials responsible for failing to prevent attacks.

entries.title: ‘Bloodbath’: Russia presses assault in Ukraine’s Soledar
entries.description: According to Ukraine, more than 100 Russian troops were killed in the battle for the eastern town during the past day.

entries.title: El Salvador renews state of emergency as gang crackdown continues
entries.description: Government says emergency measures have led to drop in murders, but rights groups raise concerns about reported abuses.

entries.title: New York nurses end strike after reaching deals with hospitals
entries.description: Pay rises and agreements over staffing levels prompt nurses to return to work after striking since Monday.

entries.title: Russia blames Armenia for breakdown of Azerbaijan peace talks
entries.description: Russia and Armenia's relationship has become fraught with tension over the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh region.

entries.title: Macron will not seek Algeria’s ‘forgiveness’ for colonialism
entries.description: Macron has prodded and soothed over the French occupation throughout his political career.

entries.title: Amnesty condemns Mozambique’s ‘forgotten war’ after viral video
entries.description: The conflict has gone on since 2017, killing 4,500 people, and forcing nearly a million to flee their homes.

entries.title: American schooling is broken if six-year-olds are now threats
entries.description: That students and teachers must fear guns in first-grade classrooms reflects on a failed school system.

entries.title: Middle East round-up: Iran sends two more men to the gallows
entries.description: Here’s a round-up of Al Jazeera’s Middle East coverage this week.

entries.title: Will Israel and Russia forge closer ties under Netanyahu?
entries.description: Ukraine has expressed its disappointment in sign that the new Israeli government may establish closer ties to Russia.

entries.title: Uranium that arrived at UK’s Heathrow not from Pakistan: Official
entries.description: Pakistani official denies British media reports after a package containing radioactive metal was discovered last month.

entries.title: Iran says ex-official had role in death of nuclear scientist
entries.description: Iran's news agency claims Alireza Akbari is implicated in the 2020 assassination of a top military scientist.

entries.title: Fourteen Malian soldiers killed in two armed group attacks: Army
entries.description: The reinforcements in response to the latest attacks led to the killing of 31 rebels, the army said in a statement.

entries.title: UAE names oil company chief to lead UN’s COP 28 climate talks
entries.description: Sultan al-Jaber, CEO of the Abu Dhabi National Oil Co, will preside over the next round of climate talks in Dubai.

entries.title: S Korea considers compensating forced labourers with public funds
entries.description: Some victims of forced labour under the Japanese during World War II denounced the plan as 'humiliating'.

entries.title: Celebrating Moroccan mothers is an act of feminism
entries.description: We can fight for rights — and acknowledge our mothers at the same time as Morocco's football team did at the World Cup.

entries.title: What’s the Republican Party agenda in Congress?
entries.description: What to expect in the US legislative agenda in the run-up to the 2024 presidential election.

entries.title: Australia finalising new security pact with Papua New Guinea
entries.description: The Bilateral Security Treaty with PNG comes after China signed a security pact with the Solomon Islands in April.

entries.title: Israel kills Palestinian man ‘standing on roof’ of his home
entries.description: Sameer Aslan, 41, was killed during an Israeli army raid on the Qalandiya refugee camp in occupied East Jerusalem.

entries.title: Photos: Benin’s famed Voodoo festival draws back Afro-descendants
entries.description: The festival is drawing people of African descent to discover the religion and land of their enslaved ancestors.

entries.title: New Zimbabwe law threatens health workers with jail over strikes
entries.description: The law, signed last week, imposes punishments of up to six months in jail for defiant workers or union leaders.

entries.title: El Salvador passes law on cryptocurrency transfers
entries.description: The bill, backed by ruling party lawmakers allied with President Bukele, aims to attract national and foreign investors.

entries.title: German police begin clearing coal mine protest camp in Luetzerath
entries.description: The expansion of a lignite mine has highlighted tensions around Germany's climate policy during the energy crisis.

entries.title: Five dead in China after car ploughs into pedestrians: Media
entries.description: Video footage shows a sports utility vehicle driving at high speed and crashing into multiple people crossing a road.

entries.title: HRW’s 2023 report finds hope amid ‘litany of human rights crises’
entries.description: Human Rights Watch says authoritarianism caused huge suffering in 2022, but sees new opportunities to strengthen rights.

entries.title: Jeff Beck, iconic British rock guitarist, dies aged 78
entries.description: Beck, a guitar virtuoso and innovator, died after contracting bacterial meningitis, his family said.

entries.title: UN calls for probe into killing of two Honduran environmentalists
entries.description: Two environmental activists were killed on Saturday after they opposed an open-pit iron oxide mine in a reserve.

entries.title: Australia cancels Afghanistan cricket series over curbs on women
entries.description: Australia pulls out of upcoming one-day series in the UAE citing Taliban's moves to further restrict women's rights.

entries.title: Benin opposition wins seats in parliament, first time in 4 years
entries.description: The main opposition party, the Les Democrates, wins 28 seats in the 109-seat parliament, preliminary results show.

entries.title: Naomi Osaka announces pregnancy, plans return to tennis in 2024
entries.description: Osaka says she will return to tennis and plans to be in Melbourne next year for the start of the Grand Slam season.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 323
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 323rd day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Are African-made vaccines the solution to vaccine inequity?
entries.description: Political leaders and experts alike are pushing to improve vaccine manufacturing across Africa.

entries.title: ExxonMobil to sell stake in Thai business for $603m
entries.description: Bangchak says purchase of controlling stake in Esso Thailand to be completed in second half of 2023.

entries.title: India top court says demonetisation was legal, victims disagree
entries.description: Tens of people reportedly died after Modi's shock move to ban currency notes, but a top court ruling brings no closure.

entries.title: Peru protests spread to Cusco, gateway city to Machu Picchu
entries.description: At least 47 people have died in the violence, including 39 killed in clashes with police and an officer set on fire.

entries.title: US, Japan agree to strengthen security ties amid China worries
entries.description: US and Japan say China is their 'greatest shared strategic challenge in the Indo-Pacific and beyond'.

entries.title: Goldman Sachs staff in Asia let go as global jobs cull begins
entries.description: US investment bank is embarking on a sweeping cost-cutting drive expected to cost thousands of jobs.

entries.title: Japan, UK sign ‘hugely significant’ defence deal
entries.description: Kishida, Sunak sign deal in London as Japan seeks to bolster ties with G7 nations amid China worries.

entries.title: Tesla nearing deal to build plant in Indonesia: Bloomberg
entries.description: CEO Elon Musk tells followers on Twitter to be 'cautious' about articles using unnamed sources after report.

entries.title: China’s flight bookings way down despite reopening, data shows
entries.description: Outbound flight bookings are only at 15 percent of pre-pandemic levels despite reopening, according to travel firm.

entries.title: Guantanamo at 21: Advocates renew calls for closing US prison
entries.description: Guantanamo's legacy of abuse, injustice and 'lawlessness' gets worse with each passing year, former detainee says.

entries.title: Canada to send armoured vehicles to Haitian government
entries.description: The vehicles come as Haiti contends with surging levels of gang violence, particularly in the capital Port-au-Prince.
